channel.title: Windows or Linux?
channel.description: Title says it all, debating on loading Linux on my Windows 7 or not. I would just like an over all opinion from you guys to know if its worth it or not.

item.title: Windows or Linux?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="_s, post:75, topic:437575"][quote author=TheCyberMan link=topic=540281.msg3957431#msg3957431 date=1332895689]
I prefer Unix based operating systems–I particularly like their GUI, reliability, and functionality.

I’d go with Linux, or if you can, go with a Mac.
[/quote]what?? Linux is a UNIX clone, there’s no codebase sharing whereas the Mach kernel does have code legacies with older UNIX systems. GUIs are completely dependent upon display systems (X server or OS X’s proprietary thing), window managers (GNOME, KDE, LXDE w/e), UI library (ie. Qt, Gtk). also i think you’ll find different UNIXes, clones and derivatives will vary in their reliability and functionality.[/quote]
he obviously just discovered the world of non-windows computing, but wants to be extra hipster

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Linux?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:67, topic:437575”]I prefer Unix based operating systems–I particularly like their GUI, reliability, and functionality.

I’d go with Linux, or if you can, go with a Mac.[/quote]what?? Linux is a UNIX clone, there’s no codebase sharing whereas the Mach kernel does have code legacies with older UNIX systems. GUIs are completely dependent upon display systems (X server or OS X’s proprietary thing), window managers (GNOME, KDE, LXDE w/e), UI library (ie. Qt, Gtk). also i think you’ll find different UNIXes, clones and derivatives will vary in their reliability and functionality.

Read full topic

Wouldn’t bother.

item.title: Windows or Linux?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:67, topic:437575”]I prefer Unix based operating systems–I particularly like their GUI, reliability, and functionality.

I’d go with Linux, or if you can, go with a Mac.[/quote]
Linux and Mac are the same (Being unix, which they are)

So the choice is efficient and free, with free apps and upgrades. (Linux)

or not being able to do almost anything, and having to pay for every upgrade, and almost every app. But you get the satisfaction of having the apple logo on your computer. (Mac)

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Linux?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Dj_:

Distro meaning which version, 11.10 and if its not what you mean then idk lol and idk where do i type the command lol im so lost on this whole thing.

Distro meaning what it is - I’m guessing from the version you gave it’s Ubuntu. There are other distros like Debian (which Ubuntu is based on), Fedora, Gentoo, Arch etc.

Go into the Unity launcher and search for “Terminal”, then open it up. Then you can enter the following command:

“sudo dd if=<windows 8 iso path> of= bs=4M”. Replace <windows 8 iso path> with the path to your Win8 iso (put it in quotes if it has spaces in), and replace with your flash disk device (should be something like /dev/sd).

Read full topic
